author: felicity
msg: bug 1843: try less complex S.1618 matching

author: akarasulu
msg: * Make sure clover is working correctly so we can get a true measure of test
coverage.  USED FORK OPTION WITH UNIT TEST PLUGIN SO CLOVER CORRECTLY
COLLECTS ITS STATS.
* Added utility method overloads to decode() in the abstract BERDecoderTest
which is used as the basis for decoder test cases:
- decode( Tuple )
- decode( byte )
- decode( byte[] )
* Wrote unit tests for Tuple encode functions
* Took a good look at how we can use the largest integer possible - right now
we truncate values due to byte boundries when encoding and decoding tags but
lengths do use the maximum value expressible by an int.  The length might be
best a long but we'll leave that until we find a need.  Presently over two
billion bytes, 2,147,483,647 to be exact can be transmitted in a single TLV's
tuple which equals a transfer stream of 2 GB.  I don't think we'll be hitting
this soon.
* svn mv src/java/org/apache/snickers/test/TestBitString.java to the
respective src/test/org/apache/snickers/asn directory to get it out of the
way for now.

author: felicity
msg: bug 2168: look for malformed/non-existent mozilla user-agent ...

author: felicity
msg: bug 2279: bayes shouldn't use 0.5 as an error condition.  leave that up to the calling functions.  we now return undef when a probability can't be calculated.  the BAYES_* rules can now include 0.5 as that's a valid probabality now.

author: felicity
msg: bug 3112: if at least one bayes token was found in the db, but they were all discounted due to their overall strength, we'd potentially continue and get division by zero errors when calculating probability.  so exit out if there are no 'strong' tokens available.
